snippet: After Democrats scored a rare legislative victory on Gov. Rick Perry’s home turf, blocking a bill to limit abortions, how he handles it could affect his hopes in 2016.
abstract: Texas Gov Rick Perry, speaking at National Rights to Life convention on heels of chaotic abortion debate in Texas Legislature, says he is considering a White House run in 2016.

byline.contributor: Jay Root writes for The Texas Tribune, which produces a twice-weekly local section in the Texas editions of The New York Times. Manny Fernandez contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After Democrats scored a rare legislative victory on Gov. Rick Perry’s home turf, blocking a bill to limit abortions, how he handles it could affect his hopes in 2016.

headline.main: For Perry, Setback in Texas May Propel Him Nationally
headline.print_headline: Setback at Home May Propel Governor Nationally
